description.narrative: Expanding and Enhancing quality TB and HIV prevention, care and control in the Republic of South Sudan.

participating-org.narrative: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
1. Number of notified cases of all forms of TB, new and relapse 2. Treatment success rate - all forms: percentage of TB cases, all forms treated among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period. 3. Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake 4. Number and proportion of MDR-TB cases notified 5. MDR TB-3??? Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment 6. MDR TB-9 Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated 7.KP-1c??? Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services 8. HTS-3c??? Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results-
9.HTS-3e Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results 10. Percentage of PLHIV who report experiences of HIV related discrimination in health care settings 11. TCS-1.1??? Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period 12. TB/HIV-6??? Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment 13. TB/HIV-5 Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status 14. PMTCT-2.1 Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery 15. PMTCT-3.1 Percentage of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth 16. M&E-2a Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received

comment.narrative: 1. Number of notified cases of all forms of TB, new and relapse -16323 2. Treatment success rate - all forms: percentage of TB cases, all forms treated among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period.- 81% 3. Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake - 82% 4. Number and proportion of MDR-TB cases notified - 68 5. MDR TB-3??? Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment - 61 6. MDR TB-9 Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated-65.50% 7.KP-1c??? Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - 60% 8. HTS-3c??? Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results- 33% 9.HTS-3e Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results - 3.50% 10. Percentage of PLHIV who report experiences of HIV related discrimination in health care settings - 13% 11. TCS-1.1??? Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period - 18% 12. TB/HIV-6??? Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment - 88% 13. TB/HIV-5 Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status - 93% 14. PMTCT-2.1 Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery - 42% 15. PMTCT-3.1 Percentage of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth - 12% 16. M&E-2a Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received - 94%

1. Number of notified cases of all forms of TB, new and relapse -22,637 2. Treatment success rate - all forms: percentage of TB cases, all forms treated among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period.- 85% 3. Percentage of laboratories showing adequate performance in external quality assurance for smear microscopy among the total number of laboratories that undertake - 95% 4. Number and proportion of MDR-TB cases notified - 100 5. MDR TB-3⁽ᴹ⁾ Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment - 100 6. MDR TB-9 Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated-80% 7.KP-1c⁽ᴹ⁾ Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services - 65% 8. HTS-3c⁽ᴹ⁾ Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results- 40% 9.HTS-3e Percentage of other vulnerable populations that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results - 4.3% 10. Percentage of PLHIV who report experiences of HIV related discrimination in health care settings - 11. TCS-1.1⁽ᴹ⁾ Percentage of people on ART among all people living with HIV at the end of the reporting period - 21% 12. TB/HIV-6⁽ᴹ⁾ Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment - 90% 13. TB/HIV-5 Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status - 93% 14. PMTCT-2.1 Percentage of HIV-positive women who received ART during pregnancy and/or labour and delivery - 50% 15. PMTCT-3.1 Percentage of HIV-exposed infants receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth - 30% 16. M&E-2a Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received - 95%
